tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
I would like to take a moment to share my wonderful experience with Dr. Kiran Reddy Chennuri and his team at Kindle Hospital. 

I traveled all the way from the US to undergo surgery for my ACL tear, as I had a limited time frame for recovery during my one-month leave. From the moment I stepped into Kindle, I knew I was in good hands. 

Dr. Kiran Reddy and his team recommended using my own hamstring graft for the surgery, which I felt was a personalized approach to my treatment. The surgery was successful, and I was impressed by the level of care provided by the entire medical staff.

The post-operative physiotherapy and rehabilitation program offered by Kindle were instrumental in my recovery. While it was initially challenging, the physiotherapy team was highly skilled, encouraging, and motivating. They helped me regain strength, flexibility, and stability in my knee. 

Within just one week after surgery, I started seeing significant improvements. The pain reduced, and I regained confidence in my knee's functionality. The dedication and expertise of the physiotherapy team played a crucial role in my successful recovery.

I am incredibly grateful to Dr. Kiran Reddy and the entire team at Kindle for their excellent care and support throughout my journey. Thanks to their efforts, I am now able to return to my workouts with confidence, knowing that I have received top-notch treatment and care.

I highly recommend Dr. Kiran Reddy Chennuri and Kindle Hospital to anyone in need of orthopedic care. Their expertise, personalized approach, and commitment to patient well-being truly set them apart.

Thank you once again, Dr. Kiran Reddy, and the entire team at Kindle, for helping me make a full recovery and regain my active lifestyle.

Sincerely,

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
I had visited for my knee pain and ankle. I got this pain while working out and I know it’s not very serious. All I was expecting is a pain relief medication.
Without investing much time on diagnosis I was asked to go for X-ray (x-ray to be taken in his clinic) and prescribed costly medication. ***** ***** ******* *** ***** ******* ** ****** ** ** **** ***** **** **** ** **** ***** ******* **** *****

I have consulted our family doctor (who stays in different city, unfortunately) *** ********* **** ** ******* ** *** ******* ****** ***** ** **** ****** *********** **** ****** *** ***** ***** **** I would suggest take medicine outside pharmacy not in the clinic. You may get different brand but with exact composition and for lesser price).

Very disappointing and would never recommend to anyone. **** ******* ***** **** **** *** ***** ** ** ******* **** ** *** *** *** ** ** ************ * ****** ***** ******** ****** ******* ******* ****** **** ** ** *** ********** *** **************** **** *********** ** *** **** ** ***** ** ****** ****** *** **** *********** ** **** **** *** ******** **** **** * ****.
reply_text:
Other reviews, much like yours, seem to stem from pseudo-intellectuals who distort the proverbial "an apple a day keeps the doctor away" to absurd extents, akin to blaming the fruit vendor for selling a defective apple because you twisted your ankle. It's essential to clarify that medical diagnosis cannot rely solely on initial presentation; it necessitates concrete evidence, such as diagnostic imaging. 

Throughout my career, I've encountered numerous instances where diagnostic tools have been pivotal in identifying life-threatening conditions, from punctured lungs, and tumours to underlying infections. Unless your doctor uncle is a Kryptonian with X-ray vision, we doctors are reliant on diagnostic aids to provide accurate care. 

Despite this, I've meticulously demonstrated, through X-rays, the degenerative changes in bones related to menopause. It's disheartening to invest time in individuals who undervalue proper treatment, especially when countless lives have been saved through diligent and accurate diagnosis.

Next time please have realistic expectations for a health care professionals or just go to a tarot card reader or a witch doctor for your diagnosis on the spot by contacting the "spirit realm" without an x-ray or even examining you.

Thank you.

review: I had pain in the left foot because i fell and injured it. Doctor advised to take xray and the result showed minor issue which was expected. But doctor advised to take blood tests which i take every year and all are fine and the recent blood report work done 6 months back also looked fine, but insisted to take the test ****** **** *********** tests costing a whopping 5000+ rupees. ** **** **** ** *** ****** *** ** *** ** **** ** *** ** ******** *** **** *** **** *** ******* ** ****** *** ****** ** **** *** *** *** **** ******* Just for a small minor pain in the leg, even xray showed that, and doctor could advise tablets**** ** *** **** **** ***** ***** *** ********* *********** ****** We are disappointed.
reply_text:
Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. We value your perspective and would like to address your concerns.

Firstly, regarding the X-ray, we understand your confusion.The X-ray and the pattern of degeneration observed in the joint did not align with the type of injury you reported two months ago. Our goal was to ensure a thorough assessment of your condition to identify any underlying issues contributing to your symptoms accurately.
The tests conducted six months ago for heavy alcohol intake, gastric issues, and colonoscopy do not directly relate to your orthopedic condition and degenerative changes. 
Dismissing pain with painkillers is not our practice. As healthcare professionals, we prioritize identifying and treating the root cause of your symptoms to provide you with effective and sustainable relief.

review: My problem was not solved after having the medicines and  the medicine cost and Xrays cost was too expensive and no proper guidance for the next step ., not satisfied with the treatment.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
I am writing this review to express my heartfelt gratitude to Dr. Kiran Reddy Chennuri for his exceptional medical expertise and compassionate care. My mother had been suffering from severe back pain for several years, and despite seeking medical help from various doctors and undergoing numerous tests, her condition only seemed to worsen with time. We were afraid that surgery might be the only option left to alleviate her pain.

However, after consulting with Dr. Chennuri, we were relieved to discover that surgery was not necessary after all. Dr. Chennuri took a holistic approach to my mother's treatment, combining physiotherapy with medication and other non-invasive techniques to address the root cause of her pain. He was patient, attentive, and always willing to answer our questions and concerns.

Thanks to Dr. Chennuri's diligent efforts, my mother's back pain has significantly reduced, and she is finally able to sleep on her right side again, something she hasn't been able to do for many years. She is now living a pain-free life, and we cannot express our gratitude enough.

I highly recommend Dr. Chennuri to anyone looking for a compassionate and skilled medical professional who truly cares about his patients' well-being. Thank you, Dr. Chennuri, for making a positive difference in my mother's life.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
Visited Dr Kiran at kindle clinics for my acute low back pain which was coming to my right leg with tingling sensations. The doctor provided me with an extensive approach to my treatment, including physiotherapy, medication, and lifestyle modifications. He prescribed me medication to reduce my pain, which was very effective in the fisrt few doses itself. In addition to that, he also advised me on changes to my posture while sitting, exercises to strengthen my back, and tips for reducing the amount of time I spend sitting in front of the computer.The phsyiotherapist Beulah was also really helpful and was very patient with me, I felt like she did her beast in reducing my pain .

I was also really impressed with the friendly and professional staff at Kindle Clinics. They made me feel at ease and were always available to answer any questions I had over the phone. I was able to avoid surgery, my back pain is now a thing of the past. However the doctor warned me that if I dont continue exercise at home the pain might come back due to weak core. 

Regards.

tags: Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Wait time,
review:
Dr. Kiran Reddy Chennuri is amazing, **** ************* *** treats patients brilliantly. 
He shares all the details, tells required precautions to be taken and next steps to be followed quite in detail.
I came for my wife's ankle hairline fracture treatment. 
I have taken treatment from him earlier also for my cartilage tear.

Now, coming to Kindle Clinics, 
They have good parking space for both cars and bikes.
Lift is a BIG issue. So, if you come with a serious injury, no stretcher is available. Lift can accommodate only 2-3 people at max.
Clinic has decent facilities with in-house X-Ray and physio room.

Major issue is attitude of staff. They don't care about you at all.
Even if you are talking to them and asking more details, they would simply  ignore and keep on discussing among them.
Very unprofessional staff. 

Consultation charges are in regular range, but other charges are HUGE.
They charged Rs. 1000/- for plaster removal (OMG).

Overall, good experience only because of Dr Reddy. (STAFF is a big turn-down though)

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
My son fractured his finger the previous night. We took the first available appointment next morning via call and reached on time to the clinic. 

The whole process was extremely expedited, it just took us 20 minutes for the entire visit. From the moment we entered the clinic to seeing the doctor, getting the x ray done,  applying a splint and leaving. The entire process was so streamlined that we could rarely see in big corporate hospitals. There was no fuss, no running around billing counters, nothing intimidating. It has a nice homely feel to it, I really wish the concept of neighbourhood clinics could come back.

The doctor was very forthcoming about the fracture and the course of recovery. He said, just rest and immobilisation alone should heal the fracture and no further surgery or medication is required. I wish kindle clinics and the doctors practicing there the very best and totally recommend it to who ever is looking for their medical needs in Gachibowli and Kokapet area. 

Regards 

Shipra G

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review: I have been suffering from persistent tennis elbow pain in my left arm for almost 6 months. I had consulted multiple orthopaedics for the same but with no satisfaction. One of my apartment community members mentioned about Dr. Kiran and I consulted him . His reassuring attitude instantly won my trust and when he suggested dry needle treatment for my pain , though I was a little apprehensive I decided to go ahead with it. What I liked best was that the doctor was very honest about how much pain the treatment would cause and about the results that the treatment would give me. The procedure was a little painful , but Dr. Kiran did it with utmost care and was very skilful and professional. My pain didn’t disappear magically after the treatment, As he had explained to me , and I was honestly a little worried , but now it’s been 2 months since the procedure was done and I diligently followed his instructions and to my amazement the pain has now completely vanished . I am back to my weight lifting workout after 9 months and I am so happy about it . Thank you doctor!! I wish I could have come to you sooner . I highly recommend him !

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
After searching a lot for doctors and hospitals with good hygiene ( didn’t want to take any risk  with COVID) , I saw Dr Kirans reviews and decided to visit him at Kindle clinics. I must say I am very impressed with Dr. Kiran for his treatment, utmost care and  for being patient with his explanation. He carefully explained all the causes and reasons while showing us images, I have never seen a doctor do that before. He was spot on with the treatment and recommended X ray, medicines and physiotherapy. I have recovered 90 % and I have few more sessions of physiotherapy. He also explained about the correct posture to work from home and how to set up my workplace, he also said that most of IT employees and coming with the same complaint. He also showed my exercises to do at home everyday. I am  super grateful that he is such a patient listener, something other doctors should learn from him. 
Special mention to very friendly staff at Kindle Clinics, who gave me a pleasant experience and maintain the clinic so hygienically and nice. Thank you

tags: Treatment satisfaction,

It was very good and encouraging experience. 
Dr’s friendliness and explanation of the condition is praiseworthy.

review: I consulted Dr. Kiran Reddy Chennuri for my knee pain. He is a brilliant doctor and is very quick to diagnose the issue and the extent of damage. I also really like the way he explains the issue with the help of the apps and images on his laptop. This is the first time I saw a doctor explaining this way, making it very easy to understand. He also emphasized on regular exercises after I recovered from the procedure. I have seen much improvement, thanks to him. It's good to have such a good doctor nearby. I wish him a long and successful career ahead.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: Deeply understanding the problem and briefing exactly what was the problem.Very polite and friendliness and guide us for the treatment to the best of the best.

review: Sir treatment is very good and he explains on what to do and not to for better health care. Everything is explained in a clear way for our understanding. I even took my family members for treatment here and results are good and positive.

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Doctor friendliness,
review:
He is very good to listen all the problems and good to diagnose & treatment.. 😊
 I am very happy to consult a Dr...

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: I had fractured my ankle while playing basketball and was treated by Dr. Reddy. I found him to be quite calm and balanced - neither overcautious, nor undercautious. Further, he also patiently answered all questions which I had. A good experience overall.[About the clinic]: The clinic is clean, and the staff is also good. They were responsive to calls/messages post consultation too. However the elevator is quite small, so if you think you'll need a wheelchair/stretcher, call the clinic first to confirm if they can provide it.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
Hi 
I am from Tamilnadu works in IT sector, I have undergoing this back pain for more then 2yrs where I couldn't consult on time. Due to wfh i have put upon weight also. I have consulted doctor kiran, my best part is Dr knew tamil also so that it was very easy for me to explain my agony, The treatment gone well the have analysed what is the issue and why is it because, they gave me step by step treatment. The physio doctor sathya also gave very good treatment and excersise which is really good. The true part i went 3yrs back in time, now it's in my hand not to get that again. Really thank you doctor for taking care of us like brother. Price is same everywhere what matters is the result I got good result. Everything matters food, sleeping position, chair sitting, bed etc. Now i got good overview need to follow only then it's good for our health.

*** **** ********** ****** * **** ********* ** **** I have got Lower Back pain (Tailbone Pain) since one year.. Consulted couple of Orthopedic and Ayurvedic doctors.. But didn't got relief..  Dr. Kiran did the Diagonisis and made X rays done at his clinic and Suggested medicine.. Every thing done in One hour..  Very fast and accurate service. 

The medicines really helped me in relieving the pain.. I would suggest Kiran sir for Orthopedic issue..   The most important part is you get Consultation, Tests and Medicines under one roof...

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
I came for my wife's back pain & mother knee pain. Doctor consulted very well & got pain free in a week. Thanks a ton to the doctor!!!

My mother was having very huge pain & was not able to walk. Doctor suggested to go Arthrex ACP® & hyaluronic acid treatment. 2 days back gave the treatment & now my mother is feeling very well. Millions of thanks to the doctor!!!

Doctor was very nice and friendly and treats patients brilliantly! He shares all the details, informs required precautions to be taken and next steps to be followed in detail. He is quite understanding and accommodative.

I would highly recommend the Doctor!!!

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: Saw Dr Kiran Reddy at Kindle clinics for pain in my shin bones. I used to run a lot and during the lockdown, I ran almost 10 km every day. I was addicted to running.  After about a month I started having severe shin pain in my legs and went to see the doctor as soon as the clinic opened again. I am thankful to have seen Dr. Kiran for this, he examined me and gave me medications for the pains. He also educated me in how the pain has started and how it will go down. He also told me about how to initiate running again and where to run and all. I really liked his approach to the problem, it sometimes seems like he is asking too many questions but trust me it is all for understanding what I was going thru and how he can help. He has officially become our family orthopaedician.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
I came across Dr Kiran reddy in 2017 when he was practising somewhere else. From then onwards our entire family is following him for all kinds of orthopaedic related problems. When we recently called up for my grandmother's appointment we were asked to come to kindle clinics in Gachibowli. We were thoroughly impressed with the setup, right from the reception staff, the nurse and Xray person were very courteous and helped us in every step of the way. Even they sent a person to accompany us to the car as grandma was not able to walk without support.

As usual Dr Kiran Reddy sir listened very patiently and gave the treatment. He asked us to follow up with just the reports. He is quite understanding and accommodative. Special thanks to Nancy for taking blood in just one prick without pain. I would highly recommend the clinic.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
Dr Kiran is friendly and had patiently listened to the problem answering all my questions for more than 45 mins. 
Doctor figured out the root cause and provided tailored treatment as required avoiding surgery. 
Clinic is very new, contains advanced X-ray equipment and well maintained to meet global standards. 
Dr Kiran personally been part of the entire process (X-ray, blood sample collection) and ensured things are carried out in right way. 
Overall had a very pleasant experience with Dr Kiran and Kindle clinic, highly recommended.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
context: Hand Pain Treatment,Wrist problems,Joint Mobilization,Orthopedic Physiotherapy,Joints and Musculoskeletal Disorders,
review: On May 2nd 2022, I had first consultation with Dr. Kiran Reddy as I was having a pain and discomfort in the wrist and hand mobilization. I had a 5th metarpal fracture on 1 Mar 2022 and had K- Wire cross fixation done on 2 Mar 2022 in AIG Hospital with a Different Orthopaedic Surgeon. As it is really difficult to catch the doctor who has done the surgery, I have decided to consult Dr Kiran Reddy at Kindle Clinics by reading very good reviews in practo.  Dr. Kiran diagnosed the root cause for the pain by prescribing few x-ray samples and few blood tests. He informed that I have a muscle loss in certain parts of the hand and due to the pop plaster the had got jammed with the lack of mobility. Also, he informed that i have a de quervain's tenosynovitis near right thumb. He suggested non invasive rigorous physiotherapy for 7 days and few medications and today i have completed the physiotherapy and the wrist and hand mobility improved a lot.  I liked the doctor way of diagnosis, identifying the root cause, patience, his non invasive methods, suggests only required treatments and avoids unnecessary panicking the patients etc. I would like to recommend the doctor for every one who are suffering with any orthopaedic disorders. Definitely you can trust the practo reviews regarding this doctor.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
Managed to tear my ACL ligament while playing basketball. MRI showed complete ACL tear but actually, as per the doctor, only one of the two bundles were torn in the knee. He did a partial ACL reconstruction surgery using my hamstring tendons as a graft at Sunshine hospital in Gachibowli. Had a very pleasant experience, the pain was managed well and I have been discharged in a day. Have already started physiotherapy and could independently go to the washroom with the help of a walker. Initially, I had a lot of apprehensions regarding the surgery as I spoke to some other people who had it done previously, it was nothing like that. The doctor had provided great clarity and explained in detail what I would go thru in each phase of recovery and it has been extremely helpful. He puts a lot of emphasis on physiotherapy and rehabilitation and made sure I stick to the regimen. I thank the staff at Kindle clinics and the anesthesiologist and nursing staff at Sunshine hospital for taking such good care and lastly, I would like to immensely thank the physiotherapist for taking great care and being very patient with my recovery. 

One place there is room for improvement in the discharge process, it almost took 6 hours from the moment the doctor has signed off my discharge to get insurance approvals and finally leave the hospital.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: It was a great experience with Dr. Kiran Reddy . My hand was dislocated and met dr. Kiran and he treated well and gave confidence to me that i can overcome from this. The treatment period was very good and i am very happy with it. He is such a friendly character I suggest Dr. Kiran  for best treatment and for a best result.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: Consulted Dr. Kiran for my knee pain. Dr. explained me about my problem in detail with patience.  He educated me to choose the suitable option & my lifestyle changes for optimised benefits. Very friendly nature and empathizes with the patient. Highly recommended.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: I have been suffering for 2 to 3 years with sleepless nights due to this bone TB. I have visited multiple doctors but none could diagnose the condition properly. Though the symptomps are very mild, Dr was excellent in catching the problem and suggested me treatment for my bone TB.

tags: Doctor friendliness,
review: Doctor is friendly but as others suggested this is a not a good service. He asked me first for X-ray at his center which was over priced. Then he suggested for MRI for which he took money at his clinic**** **** **** **** ** ******* ******* ** *** ******* ***** *** ************ **** **** ***** ******* *** ***** ** *** he wanted me take a plaster of 6k. Then I went to another doctor *** ***** ** **** **** *** *** ****** Please avoid this doctor.
reply_text:
Hi Puneet,

Thank you for taking the time to review. Let us methodically explain each of your concerns.

(1) We use state of the art Allengers High frequency and low radiation x-ray machines for the best clarity least radiation dosage, and the cost of the x-ray is on par with any other centre and definitely cheaper than all the corporate hospitals.

(2) All the blood and imaging diagnostics are processed from the clinic via well accredited and reliable labs for pinpoint accuracy and the patient`s convenience so that they don't have to run from pillar to post.

(3) And because of that, we were able to nail the diagnosis rather than shoot in the dark without any guesswork involved.

(4) We do not deploy a plaster of Paris cast for the above-mentioned condition; instead, we use a lightweight synthetic cast for optimal strength and patient comfort.

All in all, we are glad to know that you have found another doctor who could help you with this. If you need any knowledge transfer, assistance or clarification, please do not hesitate to reach out to us. 

Glad to be of service.

Thank you.
 
PS: With all due respect, please refrain from using abusive language, we as medical professionals deserve dignity like any other service providers in the market and should not be put through such harassment.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
We are very much impressed with the safety measures they follow at the clinic. It is very neat and clean and follow proper social distancing. They have a one ayya for doing regualr surface cleaning with sanitiser 

As a mother of a 2 year old i was very concerned about going to a hospital because of corona virus risk but luckily i found this clinic and by gods grace, we are doing well and my back pain also reduced.
The doctor was very helpful in making me and my family understand my situation via video call. They couldn’t be around physically due to travel, but the doctor took time to explain on the video call.

Doctor was very busy with his apple laptop ******* ****** ********* ** *******.  He advised to go to xray which is very very high cost 2200 **** ******** ** ***** *********
 After checking report, he said i will give medication after Bone density test which they are charging 4900. I requested staff that I will get the test done at outside diagnostics and consult doctor which declined and said our doctor will not look at the reports which you do outside. Only our reports will be reviwed by our doctor. ***** *** *** ****** *** ******* **** ****
Don't go by seeing consulting fee of 600 rs. They will charge double fees for all other things
reply_text:
To clarify, I was not simply occupied with an "Apple laptop", but rather utilizing Electronic Medical Records (EMR) system to maintain accurate and updated information about our patients. This is a standard practice in healthcare and helps us provide efficient and effective care to our patients, ensuring continuity of care even if physical files are lost. Using cutting-edge technology to provide quality patient care is not a crime or negligence, but rather a way to enhance the level of care we can provide. In fact, I also use an Apple iPad to show 3D human anatomy in an interactive way, which many patients appreciate.

Regarding the cost of the X-rays, it is important to note that your mother required them for both knees and her entire spine, which is why the cost was incurred. This is a standard procedure and is typically less expensive than at other hospitals or diagnostic centres.
_________________________________________________________________________


As a responsible doctor, I believe in treating the root cause of a patient's illness rather than just prescribing painkillers and sending them on their way. In the case of your mother, as she had a very early hysterectomy at the age of 23 I advised her to undergo bone density and other tests to determine the underlying cause of her symptoms.
_________________________________________________________________________
I also want to clarify that we do encourage our patients to obtain medical tests from outside diagnostic centres as long as they are accredited by national and international board standards. 
_______________________________________________________________________
We review reports from outside facilities and have tie-ups with accredited labs. If there is any discrepancy or inaccuracy in the report, we can repeat the sample for free that is the commitment we have to our patients. We can't bear the burden of inaccurate testing and inevitably delaying the diagnosis and treatment of our patients.
_________________________________________________________________________
With all due respect, If you have any further concerns or questions about the technology we use or our approach to patient care, please do not hesitate to contact us. We are always available to elaborate and address any concerns you may have. 
_________________________________________________________________________
Regards 
Dr Kiran Reddy Chennuri

review: Had visited for knee pain. The doctor gave **** medications and physio. Had relief in 5 days only. Very nice staff also.

Any one can get a CT at the rates of their 3 x-rays..
reply_text:
Thank you for your positive feedback regarding the my expertise in treating your backache.
_________________________________________________________________________
Regarding the X-ray, it is important to note that CT scans involve significantly higher radiation exposure and are not always necessary for diagnosing certain conditions. I should carefully weigh the risks and benefits of each imaging option and the extra information  it provides before making a recommendation. In your case I felt CT was NOT necessary. 
_________________________________________________________________________
You are welcome.  
_________________________________________________________________________
Warm regards 
Dr Kiran Reddy Chennuri

tags: Value for money,Treatment satisfaction,Explanation of the health issue,
review: I visited this clinic after checking some reviews in Google. He has recommended a full *** of medicine saying supplements, 5 kinds of pain relief tabs. Too expensive not at all worth for the money
reply_text:
Thank you for your feedback. 
_________________________________________________________________________
I would like to clarify that no doctor would prescribe five types of painkillers ever, it is not only ineffective but also potentially harmful to the patient's health.
_________________________________________________________________________
I wish you looked up what medication I gave on the same Google, you would have understood what I gave them for. 
_________________________________________________________________________
It is important to note that pain management involves a comprehensive approach, including medication, physical therapy, and lifestyle changes. The other medications prescribed were aimed at reducing inflammation and promoting the healing of the ligaments.
_________________________________________________________________________
Regarding the cost of medications, it is essential to consider the quality and brand of the prescribed medication. 
_________________________________________________________________________
As a doctor, I always strive to provide the best possible treatment for my patients based on a thorough diagnosis.
_________________________________________________________________________
Please feel free to reach out if you have any further concerns or questions.

reply_text:
Thank you for your feedback regarding the wait time at our clinic.

We apologize for any inconvenience caused by the wait time. Please note that unlike food delivery apps, we have constraints and real-world scenarios that can affect wait times, such as emergencies and unexpected patient needs. However, we strive to minimize wait times as much as possible and appreciate your patience and understanding.

If you have any further concerns or questions, please do not hesitate to contact us. We are always looking for ways to improve our service and patient experience.
